title.rendered: Watch out!  Alert about a new WhatsApp scam that seeks to steal your account

content.rendered:
Many people are receiving this call.

In general, people use WhatsApp on a daily basis to chat with their close ones, for work or educational purposes. However, within conversations we often share personal data or images that can be stolen very easily by cybercriminals.

A new scam has been detected in Chile after many people received a supposed call from the Ministry of Health, asking people about the vaccines they have received and requesting to answer a survey by leaving the phone online.

The curious thing about this scam is that the MINSAL has all the personal data of the vaccinated people, such as the name of the vaccine, the dose received and the current status of the mobility pass.

Once you leave the call on hold to answer this supposed survey, the criminals try to transfer your WhatsApp account to another device in order to steal the conversations that may have personal data such as bank accounts and valuable information. In case of receiving this call, it is best to hang up immediately and block the number.

The calls are usually insistent and they have already managed to steal some accounts, from which they request money in the name of the original owner.
